name: compellingly
content:
compellingly adverb
(POWERFULLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has a lot of strength or force so that it makes you believe it or accept it : argue compellingly His book argues compellingly that authority is a very poor defender of free speech. She has done an impressive amount of research and writes clearly and compellingly.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is compellingly urgent to develop new prevention strategies for at-risk groups.

compellingly adverb
(EXCITINGLY)
in a way that is very exciting and interesting, making you want to watch or listen : In his novels, he built a compellingly unique world and populated it with unforgettable characters. The answer to this question is compellingly complicated.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is not a vintage production, but it is compellingly sung and acted.He talks compellingly about his fascination for the people that watch his films.
